entry.title: 2021 Remix
entry.content:
2021 Remix

“是不是生活太艰难，还是活色生香。我们都遍体鳞伤，也慢慢坏了心肠。”
– 朴树《清白之年》

The song above happened to be one of the readings in a  Moke Chinese Exam of a district in our city. Either in Gulou or Qinhuai, I don’t quite remember.
When Mr. Yang was illustrating this reading, I saw my deskmate wrote the lyric high at the top of the paper.
I asked him why, and he shook his head.
But that sentence, which generally means “Is life too hard, or live fresh. We were all bruised, and ill-disposed.”in English, was deeply branded in my mind ever since. Because it was so beautiful and real.

Sun was just shinning bright as usual and we were having our precious PE lessons. That was when I started to feel sad as I lied down on a pad and looked up at the heavy shades of the tree leaves.
I thought about leaving. Leaving this school which I had stayed in for three years, leaving the life I was accustomed to.

The last week in my secondary school, I took a digital record pen along with me. Trying to record everything that would eventually leave me.
I recorded the wind, the chats, the flood when everyone was rushing towards the school canteen, the tones and intonations of the teachers. Sometimes the rain, the noises of fans, the drop of a pen, the fall down of a pile of books. Even the laughters, the silence.

We said goodbye. Almost everyone, Claire, Kevin, Vincent, Apple, Alice, Sun, Laura, Chloe, Cousins, Brian…

The leaving still came and I graduated from secondary school. But another story has only just begun.

Looking back at last year, I will use “leave” to describe 2021 if I can only use one word.

In this year, I graduated, I experienced my best summer holiday ever, I went to an international department, I built up this site, I met new friends. Rewinding and reconsidering, 2021 seemed so unusual.
In 2017, I graduated from primary school. It was a dark period of my life and I was very fortunate to come to my secondary school at that time. The journal I kept in 2017 was still in my wardrobe, written my thoughts in ink. Now, I still keep a journal and everytime I review it, I saw times different from those in 2017.
But that doesn’t mean 2021 is a totally-happy year. We experienced COVID-19 period and had our final exam which had a decisive influence on our future. We had a lot of pressure, suffered pain. I didn’t go to NFLS as I expected.

Time passed fast, like the stream touched across my palm when I washed my hand on the last day of 2021.

As the lyric said at the beginning of this remix.
Life is hard. You suffered a lot to get used to it. You may get cynical, you may get heart-broken.

But as long as you insist on living, accept changes, life is live.

entry.title: Why art and music therapy should be covered by health insurance
entry.content:
Imagine yourself in a room with relaxing music playing. You have a piece of paper and many pens, you draw lines, color blocks, something figurative, or objects that are so abstract that you yourself cannot even recognize fully. It may look like a dog or a leaf. What it looks like is actually unimportant, in fact, what you are drawing is unimportant too. When the nib scratches the paper, following an expected or unexpected path, your brain is relaxed… This small action smooths your brain, freeing yourself from a terrible day or even a hard life. And that, is art and music therapy.

In the Journal of The Art of Psychotherapy published in February 2018, a study looked at around 200 patients hospitalized for medical problems or surgery. Researchers found that attending art therapy for 50 minutes significantly improved their mood and reduced their pain and anxiety levels.

Thus, the benefits of art and music therapy are clear. As art and music have a deep connection to our souls, this method is considered to be advanced, giving people the necessary assistance.

Now the question arises: Why do we need art and music therapy? The therapy has been used for treating teenagers in recent years. The results turned out to be satisfying, promoting wellness and aiding psychological rehabilitation. They have also been proved to help students with no mental problems cope better, both physically and psychologically. Furthermore, art and music do not only assist juveniles. It also helps children and adults to develop communication skills and motivation for learning new tasks.

Now some may ask: “Why would insurance companies be willing to cover the expenses of this type of therapy?” I believe art and music therapy prevents mental illness from worsening. If spiritual problems were solved in advance with art therapy, it would save more money for insurance companies than if there was a serious problem. This is equivalent to reducing the probability of serious illnesses, hence the amount of compensation paid by the insurance company would decrease significantly.

To sum it all up, a challenge we are all facing right now is to prevent as much mental health problems as possible. Due to the huge amount of pressure and stress caused by school and parents, many people my age suffer from severe depression and anxiety. It is heartbreaking to see young students go as far as committing suicide because they cannot get the help they need. We need to do something before it is too late. We need to stop neglecting to our mental health. We need to make full use of art and music therapy. In order to help not only my peers, but also all those who need such help, I think it is important to obtain financial support for art and music therapy from insurance companies.

entry.title: 「Christmas Special Collection」A Scavenger Universe
entry.content:
Since It’s Christmas already, I want to share with you guys some new writings I did on this special day. It’s a tradition of mine, since 2020. When it’s Christmas, I will write about random characters that maybe exist in another universe but definitely exist in my head, and what are they doing if they are having Christmas celebration just like us. By doing this, I can feel like I’m having my Christmas Day with them, so, it’s sort of like a way I paralyze myself to feel belong. Writing is my favorite hobby, and spending time with my family is also enjoyable.

Absolutely, I did the writing first in Chinese. But I will try my best to translate them into English.

I did many writings, but I think this one is the best.

After receiving the message, Dubonnet put on a black windbreaker, finished the red wine in her glass, and went out of the house with her backpack on her back.

Even Christmas has cold nights. The family downstairs were watching the Christmas special of a cartoon, and the happy voices of the hero and heroine on TV passed through the thin air to the windows, without warming the cold street. The dim street lamps, the withered trees, and the female singer in Dubonnet’s earphones were hissing the lyrics of love.

The woman with short hair in ebony color got into the private car, as if a beetle was sneaking in the dark.

Japan also celebrates foreign festivals. Every family had decorated their houses. It could be seen from the windows that some families had also bought Christmas trees. The festival atmosphere in Mihuacho was especially more intense, and the night life could be as lively as day.

She drove to the Mihua Hotel without any expression. The children were taking group photos with Santa Claus in the hall. A tall electronic Christmas tree was set up in the middle. No one seemed to realize that a murder had occurred in a room upstairs.

As she walked into the elevator, “Jingle Bells” was still playing on the small TV, accompanied by the host’s background voice: “What is it? It was the sound of bells under the Christmas tree.”

Seeing Gin in such a living place, Dubonnet suddenly felt that “this is my kind”.

The man in black with a sense of oppression gave her a list of room numbers, threw the cigarette butt into the sealed bag in the hands of Vodka, leaving the smell of smoke and walked away.

Just passing by. Tonight, Gin seemed to have broken his record, killing at least five people in one night.

She knocked on the door of the first row of room numbers, and the first thing she saw was a very beautiful man, with a pair of eyes like phoenix’s looking at her.

“Merry Christmas!” he said, his voice muffled under his shield.

“Merry Christmas.” Dubonnet put down her backpack and put on her mask and gloves.

If Gin appeared, then 90% of the deaths were caused by gun shooting.

Being one of the scavengers working for “the Organization”, Sato Kui has her own code name, Dubonnet. This is not because she is a scavenger, but because she is not only a scavenger, but also a killer occasionally. Although the number of murders she did was very small, the Organization still gave her a code name because crime scenes had been cleaned up by her for ten years. After all, few periphery people can stay in the organization for such a long time. Sometimes it is a kind of self certification to survive.

For Dubonnet herself, ten years passed quickly. In the past ten years, she has had an idol and boss in the Organization, Gin, some long-term colleagues, and got into the Dongdu University. Her future life may also be like this. It’s so boring that she really thought it was better to die soon.

The short haired woman looked at the beautiful man who was staring at the body. He is HuaJiang Qin, one of her long-term colleagues.

“The internal organs of this body may be complete, so you can take them home. However, you may be disappointed if you want to have a brain.” Dubonnet walked up and wiped the blood on the window, “I shall say, before eating, you’d better take it to the research institute to check for viruses.”

“I know, I’m familiar with it (for cannibalism). Damn Gin, shooted against the brain, so annoying.”

Hearing what Dubonnet said, HuaJiang Qin did not hesitate to cut open the belly of the female corpse, took out the internal organs and put them away. Then he dragged the corpse into a bag and zipped it up.

After cleaning up a crime scene, they went to another room.

There was already someone else in this room. A child’s face poked out, but he was doing something unspeakable.

Dubonnet had been calm since she was shocked a few years ago. This was true. Different from HuaJiang Qin, who was known as “Hannibal of Japan”, he had a special necrophilia and was also her second long-term colleague.

They have been working together for three years.

“Zhenzhi!” HuaJiang Qin rushed close to Jin Zhenzhi, touched his head and mercilessly pushed the body away.

Dubonnet went through the process as usual. After cleaning up, she took the two people to the next room.

Finally, five rooms were cleaned up. It was already twelve o’clock at midnight.

They drove her private car to a bridge. In the quiet night, HuaJiang Qin happily plopped the bodies into the water.

She sat on a bag without a body, took off the mask and put it into the bag. On one side, the cold white color of Jin Zhenzhi seemed to glow under the dim street lamp.

Walking out of the bridge, there were fireworks blooming in the purplish red sky.

It lit up the deserted suburban streets and the eyes of the three fugitives.

Christmas, last year seemed to be the same.

“Hey… let’s go and eat Wudong Noodles.” HuaJiang Qin’s voice came.

“Cool.” She heard Jin Zhenzhi say.

“Yes! The Mihua scavengers start off!”

It was better not to shout such words.

The three of them ate Wudong Noodles which were a little slippery. HuaJiang Qin’s satisfied expression made Dubonnet felt as if she had just eaten human flesh.

“Here, Ping’an Fruit.” He took out three apples from nowhere, one for each.

This year’s Christmas seemed to be the same as that of ordinary people’s. At the thought of the scene where the body was just thrown, Dubonnet withdrew the idea.

However, when driving home, feeling the apple in arms, her mood was slightly different.

entry.title: How Do I Spend My Everyday Life
entry.content:
Things to say in the beginning:
In this webpage I will illustrate my daily routine, because it is time for me to update my GitHub and I just thought: “Okay, why don’t I just do this.“ So I do this. There is no specific reason, just something I came up with.

6:00 A.M.

I usually wake up at 5:55 a.m., however most of the time I just lie in my bed and wait until it is 6 a.m., then my alarm on my phone will ring with symphonic kind of vibration. With another 10 minutes, I still lie on my bed, and then finally I dress up.

In 20 minutes, I finish my breakfast and wear sunscreen just to avoid suntan. Then I check the bus mini-program on Wechat to see whether my bus has coming.

Often I get on the bus at around 6:50 a.m..

7:00 A.M.

On the bus, I read my e-book just to fully use my spare time, currently I am still reading Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality, for the third time.

When I arrive at school it is often early, at almost 7:15 a.m.. At this time, I will plan and outline my whole day using a planner book, putting what classes I will have and what to do today on it, and sketching out timelines. When I finish writing, it is usually time for class, and for those times when I finish planning ahead of time, I do past-papers exercises.

After each class, I will note down on my planner about what did we learn in three lines. This helps me focus on lessons and review, and also remind me of what to review when I go home. Sometimes, when the teacher announce that a test is coming, I will write down the day and what the topic is of the exam with blue pen on the planner beside my review, just to highlight.

During breaks, I go to the toilet or chat with my friends, or I go upstairs to hand in Math homework because at school I am one of the Math representers.

12:00 A.M.

I go to the school canteen to have my lunch at about 11:55 a.m.. After that, I will hang out with my friends and do past-papers exercises. Or if I have any questions, I will go upstairs to ask my teachers, because we have a long break after lunch.

5:00 P.M.

We finish our day at school at 5 p.m.. Then my friends and I will go running. Usually we just run for 3 rounds around the playground, about 900 m, and then go home by 5:20 p.m..

7:00 P.M.

Going home with my e-book reading, it is usually 6:00 p.m. when I arrive home. Then I send the homework into our class’s QQ group since I am the study monitor, and I plan my evening on my planner.

First I review again what I did today, then I figure out what things that I haven’t done yet and I will list them as my evening tasks. Next, I will look at my habit tackler, and check whether I have followed daily goals like “drinking 8 glasses of water” or “eat less sugar”, and then do tasks like “learning Korean/Spanish” and “Pipa Practice”. After finishing up most of the things on my tackler, I will do the evening tasks.

Then I will receive a call from a friend of mine in another school, and we will chat for a while just to share how our life is going.

I have an alarm on my phone that it will ring at 9:00 p.m., which will remind me it is time to go to bed.

9:00 P.M.

I speed up to finish my day work when it is 9 p.m.. I usually manage to finish all of them at 9:30, depending on whether I need to wash my hair that day because washing hair means longer time spent on showering.

10:00 P.M.

Most of the time I can go to bed at around 10:00 p.m. I do this because I need to make sure that I have 8 hours sleep everyday, from 10 p.m. to the other day’s 6 a.m.. When I am really busy though, I go to bed at 10:30 p.m..

However, on weekends I can sleep whenever I want.

And this is basically my day.

It is still not very productive, but I enjoy this kind of life. Especially when I run with my friends after-school, looking at the sunset, thinking nothing but just focus on running, it is always a pleasure.

However, sometimes when I cannot function, unwilling to do anything, I just think in my own world without following my schedule.

End.

entry.title: China's Dual Control Policy:Analysis of Effects and Alternative Policies
entry.content:
I. Introduction

Global warming and air pollution has become one of the most serious problems; The cost of our success is the exhaustion of natural resources, leading to energy crises, climate change, pollution, and the destruction of our habitat. China, as an emerging country with rapid growing economy, accounted for 23% of global energy consumption and 34% of the net increase in global energy consumption. In an attempt to control this, Chinese government introduced “Dual Control” policy in 2021. China accurately announced in the 13th FYP for Energy Development (2016-2020). The Government of China aims to develop the energy sector in order to achieve sustainable development.

In this presentation, we will first introduce the existing policies in China, discuss the pros and cons of Dual Control policy and propose alternative policies accordingly. We will then look at the benchmarks to be considered when coming to which policies to use.

II. Benefits

China has witnessed a steady decline of carbon emission intensity since the policy has been introduced in 2005, while still managing to achieve economic growth, as shown in the picture. Reducing emission intensity means that less polwarminglution is being created per unit of GDP. By the end of 2020, China’s carbon intensity has dropped by about 48%.[2]. This has made significant implications in terms of sustainable development as global is causing sea level to rise and, hence, the amount of fresh water and land to reduce, as shown in the picture as an inward shift of PPC of the country.

Moreover, the dual control policy pushes companies and industries to invest in R&D and become more efficient in the long run. Thus, this would reduce cost of production and increase LRAS from LRAS 1 to LRAS 2, increasing potential economic growth. take light power as an example. Even though such transition may incur cost in the short run, industries will benefit in the long run as light power is more efficient in terms of generating energy. Firms benefit from photo-voltaic investment. It improves the not only productivity, but also working environment of workers. To some extent, it could alleviates the power supply pressure of the local power grid. The picture shows that nearly two thirds of China’s provinces are subject to power rationing by 2021.

The policy also raises China’s reputation and status in international cooperation, and increases its international competitiveness. With the global trend in reducing carbon emission, China worked with other countries in improving clean energy productions and cooperated with India and Malaysia in innovations. According to the of China Automobile Industry Association, in 2021, The four leading Chinese brand automobile enterprises witnessed over 100% growth in their export of electrical vehicles to the world.

III. Costs

Nevertheless, the downsides of the policies are just as compelling.
First of all, the suppression of production and time taken to adapt to clean energy production may lead to a direct reduction in output. The dual policy directly limit production of some important materials and capital goods such as iron and steel. This will increase cost of production for the other industries as well. Thus, this may result in further decrease in SRAS, shown in Fig 2.5 as a leftward shift from SRAS1 to SRAS2, causing cost push inflation. This may also make our export less competitive internationally, reducing Aggregated Demand. What’s more, the restriction in production and carbon emission may discourage Foreign Direct Investment as foreign firms may face higher costs and hence, less willing to set up production in China. This would further reduce AD from AD1 to AD2. Thus, total output/ real GDP decreases from Y1 to Y2.

Moreover, the problem of unemployment is likely to become more severe. Due to the reduction in output, demand for labor would also decrease, mostly for primary and secondary industries using non-renewable resources. This would cause structural unemployment. For example, industries such as Sinopec Nanjing Chemical Industries laid off 10% of labor as the firm decreased 14% output using hydrogen as its main resource. Even though new jobs are created in renewable energy sector, since the unemployed may not have the necessary skills, they may find themselves remain structurally unemployed. This may result in an increase in national unemployment rate and a growing social instability.
Another disadvantage is that the world will face a shortage in factors of production. As illustrated above, since China plays an import roll in global supply chain, a reduction in China’s production of manufacturing may disrupt the supply chains for other countries. Thus, the world may suffer from higher price level and a loss in factors of production.

The shortfall in coal supply is also believed to be the chief cause of a severity and scale of the recent wave of power outages sweeping across two-thirds of the under-performing provinces’ region. However, this challenge is met with China’s ambitious carbon pledges that have turned energy consumption control into a highly prioritized nationwide campaign, essentially forming a strong “policy crunch” against under performing provinces that has forced them to resort to power rationing to meet dual-control targets, which results in power outrages in many regions.

IV. Alternative Policies

we have three suggestion keep growth rate and unemployment rate.
First, retraining scheme for structurally unemployed workers.
Even though jobs in manufacturing industries were reduced due to the dual policy control, jobs in new energy sector are created. Government could offer training for the unemployed to increase their occupational mobility to fit into the new jobs. Thus, the unemployment rate will decrease. According to the ESCO Committee of EMCA, as of the end of twenty seventeen, there were over 6000 enterprises engaged in energy-saving services with around 0.7 million employees.

Second, providing subsidy to help industry’s transformation.
With the help of financial support from government, industries will have enough money to keep doing researches and innovate in constant rate. For instance, China publish On improving the financial subsidy policy for the promotion and application of new energy vehicles in 2020. In this policy, new energy industry will have a large amount of subsidy,. If we look at the data from graph, we can find the produce amount of car decrease from 2017 to 2020 but increase after 2020. It is hard to say the policy has no relationship with the fact that many new energy car brands appear After two thousand and twenty, like MAPLE, Skywell, which show that subsidy is benefit for industry.

Third, using decarbonization to make transition smoother.
To mitigate the output loss due to the time needed to switch to clean energy production, decarbonization could be installed first to make the transition smoother. Using decarbonization may be fast. By using Carbon neutralization equipment like hydrogen production equipment, industries could keep producing while reducing carbon emission. This could limit the output loss and unemployment. Take Sinopec as example, Sinopec will build “oil, gas and hydrogen electric service” comprehensive energy stations and complete the transformation of 5,000 gas stations.

V. Benchmark

The Government should use the unemployment rate and inflation rate as standard, whether the policy or the influence is control-able or not, to be published to the public.

VI. Conclusion

After the reviewing the effects of Dual Control Policy on economic sectors and also the whole society, our opinion would be to support Chinese government to expand and carry on its DCP scheme for the current situation. During the expansion, China must carefully monitor the economy and balance its plan accordingly. It is recommended that China takes the economic and population advantages brought by COVID-19 pandemic and quickly retrain workers to new position provide subsidy to encourage industry firms to switch to new energy and decarbonization to make transition smoother.

entry.title: 100 Tips for a Better Life
entry.content:
100个生活建议
关于100 Tips for a Better Life的中文翻译。
原文作者：Ideopunk
原文网址：
https://www.lesswrong.com/posts/7hFeMWC6Y5eaSixbD/100-tips-for-a-better-life

财产

1.如果你想要知道人们对一个产品的意见，用谷歌搜索<产品名>reddit。你会得到真正的意见，而不是搜索引擎想让你看到的。
2.注册账号时，一些银行收你20刀，一些银行不收钱。如果你的银行属于前者，问清楚那20刀是干什么用的。
3.你人生中大部分时间都要用的东西（床：1/3，公司座椅：1/4）是值得花钱的。
4.“那个好用的刀在哪？”如果你在找你的好的X，说明你有坏的X。把它们扔出去。
5.如果你的工作是需要在电脑上完成的，买两个设备。更少的时间在窗口间横跳意味着更多的时间可以用来思考。
6.关于什么时候扔垃圾要有明确的规定。一旦规定确定了，垃圾就不会是一个问题了。这是因为明确的规定相比我们含糊的计划要更占优势（“留着这个立体声回响最多5年，以防有天我知道该怎么修它了”）。
7.不要给别人买CD。他们有音乐软件。给他们买他们喜欢的乐队的周边。这样更加私人化而且乐队能赚更多的钱。
8.在买东西时，时间和金钱相互权衡。如果你钱少，花更多的时间找到最好的交易。如果你时间少，停止四处找最好的交易并在线快速买东西。

烹饪

9.煮的分钟：绿茶3，红茶4，凉茶5。好茶就是这么简单！
10.食物其实可以既便宜，健康，好吃又可以相对快速地做好。这只需要在某一天中花几个小时准备一整周的许多菜。
11.烹饪会污染空气。烹饪后把窗子打开几分钟可以极好地提高空气质量。
12.通过简单的调味料，食物的味道可以变得令人更加兴奋。这也是一个可以表达情感的机会。买一些草药和香料并去实验吧。
13.在搜索食谱时，在前面加上“最好的”。你会发现更好的食谱。

效率

14.带上高级的搜索特征是创建更紧密搜索语句的快速方法。比如输入“img html”会比“img html -w3”输出更差的结果。
15.你可以用Autohotkey（或者AppleScript）使电脑自动化执行普通任务。如果你不停在做一系列“简单到一个电脑都会做的事”，让电脑做。
16.学键盘快捷键。它们很容易上手而且你做任务时会更快更容易。
17.完成比完美好。
18.保持桌面和工作环境整洁。把每个物品当作一个你不值得注意的东西，因为它就是。一个工作的地方不是一个你存储堆积的地方。它是一个完成事情的地方。
19.完成挑战后给自己奖励，即使完成得很糟糕。

身体

  1. 20-20-20守则：每看屏幕20分钟，花20秒看一个离你20英尺远的地方。这会减少眼睛疲劳而且易于记忆。
  2. 锻炼（举重）不仅会创造肌肉质量，也会优化骨架结构。举！
  3. 锻炼是你可以做的最重要的生活方式介入。即使是很少的（15分钟一周）也会有很大的影响。从小做起。
  4. （这不是一个医学建议）不要在复合维生素上浪费钱，它们没有用。维生素D倒确实有点用并且重要，因为人们经常缺维生素D。
  5. 在过去十年里手机变重了而且它在你手上时其实还蛮坚硬的！有条件的话还是用一个电脑，或者至少试着把手机支起来。

成功

25.历史记得那些第一个得到市场的人。将你的创造推向世界比让它完美更加重要。
26.你是不是在分手或者换工作的边缘？你应该就去这么做。人们，平均来说，如果他们冒险，最后他们会更快乐点。
27.纪律胜于动机。前者可以被训练，后者是短暂的。你不会有能力去做伟大的事如果你只依赖动机。
28.你可以通过练习提高你的交际能力，这比你通过练习提高你的智力要更加高效。即使你没有那么聪明但是可以清晰地表达观点，与那些不能表达清晰的人相比，你也有很大的优势。
29.你不是生活在电子游戏里。你做蠢事或对着错误的方向走太远时不会有警告弹出来。你必须创造自己的警告。
30.如果你在听成功人士讲述他们的方法，记住那些用同样方法却失败的人并不会也做关于他们失败的视频。
31.最好的建议是私人化的，而且来源于一个熟知你的人。如果需要，接受广泛的建议，但最好的帮助来源于爱你的诚实朋友。
32.让事情完成得越简单越好。找到最简单的方法开始锻炼。找到最简单的方法开始写作。人们让事情比原本更加困难并当失败时变得心烦。试着不要这么做。
33.培养可靠性名声。好的名声是有用的因为它们很稀有（容易被摧毁而且很难重建）。你不需要做出最好的咖啡如果你的顾客知道咖啡永远是热的。
34.你怎么过的每一天就是你怎么过的你的人生。

理性

35.找到别人的偏见很容易，找到自己的偏见很难。然而，它的回报要高得多。
36.解释问题是好事。通常在分析问题的过程中，解决方法会自然而然出现。
37.愚蠢的人在大多数事情上是对的。努力不让愚蠢的人的意见被自动诋毁。
38.你有一个计划。一个来自2030年的穿越者出现了并告诉你你的计划失败了。你觉得你的计划是哪一步出错了？修正那一步。
39.如果某件事让你惊讶了一遍又一遍，停止惊讶。
40.你应该在看到在百度上你的症状显示你得了绝症时吓得魂飞魄散吗？最好不要！查找疾病的基率并用贝叶斯定理计算。
41.自私的人应该听从建议以让自己不自私，不自私的人应该听从建议以让自己自私。这适用于许多事情。不管什么时候得到了一个建议，同样也要思考它的反面。你可能会过滤出你最需要的建议。
42.常见的系统和工具是被设计成所有人都可以掌握的样子的。所以不用担心你会不会是唯一一个不能的！你可以学会洗衣服，烹饪，在高速上开车的。

自我

43.缺点不会显得你特殊。你年龄越大，在别人眼中你不会做饭的严重性就越大。
44.通过更多地了解你的欲望、目标和结构，没有什么人际状况是无法改善的。“认识你自己！”
45.如果你小于90岁，尝试一些事情。
46.一些不是你的错的事可以仍然是你的责任。
47.用你承受的痛苦来定义你自己是一个持续痛苦的高效方法（比如非自愿独身者，精神创伤）。
48.保持你的身份渺小。“我不是做那种事情的人”不是一个解释，是一个陷阱。它阻止书呆子出去工作，阻止男人跳舞。
49.不要把“因为我喜欢所以我做这件事”和“因为我想被看作是会做这类事的那种人所以我做这件事”混为一谈。
50.记住你在死去。
51.事件可能会伤害我们，不仅仅是我们对它们的看法。建立韧性是件好事，但有时如果真的有事情让你崩溃了，那不是你的错。
52.如果你想要变得有趣，试着只是说些蠢话（在合适的场合）直到找到感觉。
53.为了发现你的问题，（大声地）说“我生活中的一切都非常好”。注意你脑中是什么反对意见正在浮现。
54.拖延来的很自然，所以把它应用到坏事上。“我现在想要自残。再过一个小时我会自残的。”“我想吸烟了，所以半个小时之后我会去吸烟的。”然后重复。就像我们的好计划可以延迟，我们的坏计划也可以。
55.个人顿悟感觉很棒，但它们会在几周内消失。顿悟后，制定计划并开始实际改变行为。
56.有时无法解决的问题，比如“我的目的是什么？”和“我为什么要存在？”在生活方式修复上失去力量。换句话说，定期见朋友和充足的睡眠可以大大有助于解决关于存在主义的问题。

隐患

57.有两个可以避免几乎所有危险的人的危险信号：1.经常抱怨的人；2.狂暴的人。
58.有些人出于习惯将所有事情戏剧化。你可以避开这些人。
59.那些让你产生焦虑并向你保证他们有解决方法的人是骗子。看看政治家，商人，法轮功大师等等。避开这些人。
60.（这不是一个合法建议）不要和警察讲话。
61.让人们谈论自己的价值观、目标、规则和生活方式很容易。当人们的行为与他们的言论相矛盾时，请注意！
62.“如果他们会对你这么做，他们就会对你这么做”和“靠剑生活的人死于剑下”是一个道理。你对你自己、朋友或队友说的恶意的借口总有一天会回到你身边，那个时候你就没有借口了。

他人

63.在犹豫和0-1个人还是和2个以上的人住在一起时，记住当室友大于1时，责任会被分散而不会被确定（“这些是谁的盘子？”）
64.明白人们有权没有品味。
65.你甚至会阻止自己有有可能降低你地位的想法。避免因为这样人们就会一直认为你很酷而把自己挡在外。
66.在群体里很重要。如果你不想加入运动队，考虑建立一个糟糕的乐团。这是你最接近RPG的游戏。与2-4个其他角色一起训练，学习新动作，从一个酒吧到另一个酒吧，并从NPC那获得任务。
67.让人们做一些让你更喜欢他们但更不尊重他们的事情是有可能的。避免这种情况，它会破坏关系。
68.想想你为什么喜欢你喜欢的东西。如果你能解释你对《沙丘》的热爱，你现在不仅可以与《沙丘》的粉丝交流，还可以与喜欢有同样方面的其他书籍的人交流。
69.当你问人们：“你最喜欢的书/电影/乐队是什么？”而他们结巴了，就问他们目前最喜欢哪本书/电影/乐队。他们几乎总是有一个，并且能够谈论它。
70.感到无聊的人很令人无聊。
71.与家人一起吃饭时不看东西的规范将导致更好的对话。如果这个想法让你充满恐惧，考虑建立一个新家庭。
72.如果你要乘坐公共汽车去其他城市，请考虑拼车。它更便宜、更快，并会导致有趣的对话。

交往

73.在人际关系中寻找一个你喜欢而且可以和他仅是在附近闲逛的人。长期关系大多只是令人扫兴。
74.有时事情会持续很长时间，因为它们很好（什锦菜）。但这并不意味着，因为某物已经持续了很长时间，所以它是好的（尿道割礼）。酌情将此应用于关系、职业和信仰。
75.不要向同事或在线抱怨你的伴侣。好处可以忽略不计，代价是会一点一点摧毁你的灵魂。
76.分手后，尽快停止所有联系。产生一个戏剧的潜力是无穷无尽的，而建立良好友谊的潜力微不足道。等一年后再试着再次成为朋友。
77.如果你还没有弄清楚性吸引力问题，请记住没有最后期限。如果有人让你感觉有，请考虑他们对你来说不再单单是你的朋友的可能性。
78.如果你在约会期间说话有困难，试着说任何你想到的话。在最坏的情况下，你会毁掉一些约会（反正进展总不会顺利的），最好的情况下你会有一些很棒的对话。酒精会有所帮助。
79.在约会时，不强调你的怪癖会导致90%的人认为你有点好。强调你的怪癖会导致10%的人认为你迷人而有趣。那些是有兴趣和你约会的人。瞄准他们。
80.保持关系需要刺激。新冠疫情期间很难有新奇——但你计划过新冠疫情后的冒险吗？
81.人们可能不是坏，只是不适合你。做人既复杂又困难。

共情

82.当你想你的父母时，给他们打电话；当你爱你的朋友时，告诉他们。
83.更多地赞美别人。除非别人说，否则许多人很难认为自己聪明、漂亮或善良。你可以帮他们。
84.如果有人正在接受群体批评，有一部分的你会想加入这正义地摧毁某人的乐趣。抵制这一点，因为这样你只会给世界增添丑陋。无论如何，他们已经吸取了要吸取的教训，而且这可能不是你会想要吸取的教训。
85.培养对比你更不聪明的人的同情心。许多人并非是因为自己的过错，而无法处理表格、骗子或复杂情况。善待他们，因为世界并不善待他们。
86.为有困难的人培养耐心。沟通极其复杂，涉及传达语气和难懂的想法。许多人几乎这两件事都做不到。不要惩罚他们。
87.不要因为那些人尝试而惩罚他们。你要教他们不要尝试你的底线。惩罚包括抱怨他们花了这么长时间，他们做得不好，或者其他人做得更好。
88.请记住，许多人遭受无形的痛苦，一些最严重的痛苦是羞耻。不是每个人都能让他们的痛苦变得清晰。
89.不要因为人们承认自己错了而惩罚他们，你让他们更难提高。
90.一般来说，你会找借口不善待人。抵制这些。

快乐

91.人类的情绪和福祉受到简单事物的严重影响：锻炼、良好的睡眠、光明、感受自然。尝试这些很便宜。
92.你的政治影响力越来越小，你花在政治上的每一个想法都可能一无所获。考虑搭建东西吧，或者至少去散步。
93.史特金定律认为，90%的东西都是垃圾。如果你不喜欢诗歌、美术或其他东西，很可能你只见过垃圾。去看看它们吧！
94.你不必热爱你的工作。工作可以是很多事情，但它们也是赚钱的一种方式。许多人通过将赚来的钱花在自己关心的事情上，而在一份好工作中过着美好的生活。
95.某些种类的复杂化不会让你更享受它，而是会让你更不享受它。例如，葡萄酒品师并不比你更喜欢葡萄酒，他们只会更敏锐地意识到大多数葡萄酒不够好。避免会减少你的享受的精致。
96.如果其他人过得比你更糟糕意味着你不能难过，那么其他人过得比你更好意味着你不能快乐。感受你的感受。
97.喜欢和想要是不一样的。有些东西比如垃圾食品，你想要但不喜欢。但你也可以喜欢有些东西（如阅读），而不需要它们。如果你记得喜欢某样东西，但现在对它没有欲望，试着推动自己。
98.人们没有意识到他们有多讨厌通勤。离工作地点非常远的好房子不值得你生活中的无聊和疲劳。
99.有证据表明，内向者和外向者都能从被推向更外向的过程中受益。下次你不确定是否想出去的时候，请考虑一下。
100.坏事会发生得戏剧性（大流行病）。好事会逐渐发生（疟疾死亡人数每年下降），所以感觉不像是“新闻”。努力跟踪好事，以避免对世界的看法不准确和感到沮丧。

entry.title: Clouds, Bullets and Me
entry.content:
WARNING: This is not a very scientific fiction don’t believe anything below.
I shoot a gun to the sky on this big field every day. Even though there’s no athlete or athletic track here. I don’t mean to suicide or kill anyone either. I am just waiting for a person. You can also say, a cloud.
I was a PE teacher. I once was an assassin but that was before a white snake bit me. I bossed athletes around. I shot to the sky to let my students know when to run. Always waiting for them at the end of the track. They were often both tired and happy in the end. And me, just walked around the school or enjoyed the air conditioner down in the school’s secret basement, and that was all. I also liked the scent of grass and books best which reminded me of my youth.
Down in my secret basement, my only companies were books, balls and the gun I used to shoot. I have used that gun for a long time and I will never throw it away. Our headmaster had persuaded me several times to buy a new gun and he even offered me a new office. “Are you farting?”I said. This basement was my palace of sweet memories, only ghosts would give them away.
One day, I peeked out of my basement and surprisingly saw a fluffy cloud. The cloud I saw, was livable. It was lying on the grass, rolling and crawling. It changed from big to small when it sighed. I touched it. Not as foggy as I imagined, but warm and soft. “I’m about to dry. ”it told me. So I took it to my basement and poured water over it.
It quickly expanded and filled the whole room. “Sorry, ”it said, “I was too excited. Let me change.”It shrank and went into my empty bottle as a matter of course, white as milk. “What are you doing here?”I asked. “Oh you wanna know?Okay I’ll tell you.”the cloud said.
It came from the cloud factory. That was a factory on the sky. Its son really loved eating bullets. “Bullets?”I asked. “Yeah,bullets.”it said. So it looked for bullets everywhere in the atmosphere. When people shot, it caught the bullets on the sky. 10 bullets for a spoon, 20 for a plate, 30 for a bowl. It circled around only because its son liked eating bullets.
But later, there was a war. The bullets it caught were decorated with blood. They couldn’t eat hates. After the war, new technology was developed which made guns not popular any more. Still they couldn’t eat much bullets. Finally, it caught one, which was from our school. From then on, it only needed two places to go: our school and its home. “It’s too dangerous.”its son said to it. “How can I not give the best to you?”it replied.
The Sun was too hot today, the water it stored ran out and it fell out of the atmosphere, right landed on our playground. Then it met me.
I put it back into the sky. After that, I shot the sky everyday. It couldn’t take bullets away, because they couldn’t ask for anything from human. That sucks.
Unfortunately, another war began. I hid on my field, retired. Nobody knows where I live. The cloud came down sometimes, to chat with me.
At last, it told me it felt sick.
It never came back.
I shoot a gun to the sky on this big field every day. I am just waiting for a person. You can also say, a cloud. And the day I close my eyes.

A/N: This is a story I post to take part in March writing contest 2020 on Quotev in 2020. It came in third, though it wasn’t a very official contest.

entry.title: IGCSE ESL Full Mark Book Review
entry.content:
Task:
Write a book review.

Model Answer(16/16):

Three Worlds Collide
Can you imagine a scene where another more well-developed planet wants to change humanity in the name of “for Earth’s own good”? This happened in the book Three Worlds Collide, written by Eliezer Yudkowsky.
Set in the future, on an aircraft where almost all the most outstanding scientists are there to seek for possibilities of new civilizaitons, humans find two planets where there are species having self-concious just like human. One species has a lower standard of living, and the other kind has a better developed environment than Earth. However, their understanding of morality are totally different from humanity. I won’t spoil whether human will be able to persuade the other planets or be persuaded, or find another way to solve the human nature problem.
The book is very thought-provoking and you will find it thrilling when people in the story start to have quarrels and debates. You will never know the ending unless you have read it to the very end. It uses witty tone and pithy writing style to present to readers three worlds colliding which was very successful.
It has a serious message, too. “Right or wrong, the belief is all it takes.” The three worlds hold different beliefs and with different ranks of technology, there can only be one morality left. When our belief is threatened, will we be able to identify the true righteous belief, no matter what it costs? This is what the author trying to bring us to think about.
The novel provides a scientific and rational insight into a possible future situation and humanity. Students who are in favor of philosophy and rationality will find it particularly interesting.


About:
This is a book review I wrote and is marked by Ms. Leila.
Here are some tips about how to write a book review:
what you should include:

  1. start with a question
  2. I’d like to recommend…
  3. Set in…(main story)
  4. main hero/book character
  5. message
  6. recommend audience & conclusion

how to write a book review:

  1. inform-title & written by__
  2. describe-set in… & tells the story…
  3. analyse-talk about what impressed you the most about the story.
  4. advice-who should read this story

entry.title: IGCSE ESL Full Mark Movie Review
entry.content:
Task:
Your class is starting a film club for all students. Your Head of English would like students to submit reviews about films they would recommend for the club. Reviews will be published in the school newsletter.
Write a review about a film you would recommend for the school film club.

Model Answer(16/16):

Cruella
Have you ever seen the Disney made the villian the main character in its film? Most people only know those kind-hearted heroines, like Cinderella and Snow White. However, Cruella, directed by Craig Gillespie, a Disney film, tells a different story.
Set in the storyline of the 101 Dalmatians, the lead character is in fact the villian Cruella De Vil who has black and white hair. Her real name is Estella, and she is raised by a very kind but poor mother. But even though she has a mother like a princess from Disney, her dark side, Cruella, played by Emma Stone, grows bigger and bigger. By accident, Estella’s talent in designing clothes is discovered by the most famous fashion designer Baroness von Hellman. However, she later finds out that the designer is actually the one who killed her mother. I won’t spoil whether she will use her darkside to revenge or not.
The film has a quirky plot and many memorable scenes. When Estella is designing, the clothes are so gorgeous that everyone in the movie theater gasped. Every move of the film is essential and not too many songs are contained in the show, which is a success for Disney movies. It also has a serious message, that not only the princesses and kind people can be the heroes, but everyone can be a hero to their lives.
“I’m a woman, hear me roar.”This has become many people’s quote since Cruella came out. This is a masterpiece in films and is a turning point for Disney movies. Students in the film club and those who like films should find it particularly intersting.


About:
This is a movie review I wrote as my month-end test. In the test, all the names included above were all made up, but that didn’t affect my score. So it’s okay if you forget the actors’ and actresses’ names.
However, this review still has many problems as it was being written during an exam.

Addition:
Cruella is not that “masterpiece”, anyway.

entry.title: IGCSE Economics is Not Worth Summarizing
entry.content:
This is inspired by Socrate:
“The unexamined life is not worth living.”

Indeed.

It’s not that I don’t want to summarize IGCSE Economics Theory. Actually, I’d wondered why popular IG websites don’t establish IG Econ Theory(which can surely earn good money) for several times.
I thought it was easy.
Especially for INTJs like me, plus I’ve been developing my Economic skills, summarizing should be no big deal.
However, the process was agonizing.
But I’m not going to start snapping about how exhausting it was. No. That’s not my style.
I’ll analyse.

I define a thing “worth doing” by comparing it with playing video games. I like playing video games, that’s common sense. So if something can let me choose it instead of putting my fingers on the “game” icon, it means this thing is either essential(at the deadline) or interest me more than games do.
Almost everyone needs a motivation to push him/her foward. My motivation is “interest”. I am interested in writing, so I am able to keep a diary for many years. If I find something I don’t want to do anymore(lose my interest), I quit.(What if I don’t like study? I apply my hobbies to my study, keep me fresh and try to make myself feel interested.)
Because I know I won’t do this even in the future, I stop doing it. Because there is no more reason for me to keep on working on it. Because I lost my interest. Instead of making myself miserable and thirst for video games, I go and play video games. As I’m aware, I am no longer willing to finish summarizing the theory of IG Economics, and possibly not going to finish it in the future, I open my phone and turn to playing games.
It’s not like finding myself an excuse to not do the right but boring things. It’s seeking what’s really worth doing. If something can’t raise my interest, then it is meaningless for me to do. You could say, summarizing IG courses is meaningful because it can help students worldwide, but “meaningful” isn’t the whole. Remember “interest” I talked earlier?
Given a fact that, what I am interested in are all meaningful things, though not all meaningful things I am interested in(like, all bad witches are from Slytherin, but not all Slytherins are bad witches).
Now a second fact, I can only finish something when I am interested in it.
So the whole puzzling problem(Why I didn’t finish summarizing IG Econ) now turns into two simple questions: a. Is it because I just don’t have interest in it? b. Is it because summarizing IG Econ itself is meaningless for me?

Question a:
Yes, I lost my interest in summarizing IG Econ. But I was interested in it until I made it to “Section 7 Demand”.
Is it because I found the sections were too many and I overawed by the difficulties? No. If I can manage the whole IG Extended Math Theory without throwing up, IG Econ should be also nothing to be afraid of.
Is it because I was too excited about the Spring Festival? No. The time I was doing Ex M Theory was both the end of Christmas and the start of Winter Holidays.
Is it because I don’t have the ability to summarize IG Econ? No. I scored 90/100 in the end term test and rose in rank in the NEC DR group.
…
Result: Why I didn’t finish summarizing IG Econ isn’t because I just don’t have interest in it.

Question b:
Result: Why I didn’t finish summarizing IG Econ is because summarizing IG Econ itself is meaningless.
Why? because possible reason a has been retorted.

That’s it? IG Econ is meaningless for you to summarize? But seriously, why? Apart from the reason that you are not interested in it?
The answer is: No. Yes. I’ll tell you why(after thinking for a long time).

The Study and Revision Guide of IGCSE Economics written by Paul Hoang has all you need to get. It has definitions, knowledge points, even exam style questions. Colourful pictures, clear structures, beautiful mind-maps, I have nothing to summarize anymore and I believe I can’t do it better than him.
It’s impossible to summarize IG Econ in Chinese. Too many definitions need to be recited in English, too many specialized vocabulary need to be frequently appeared in English(so you can be familiar with them).
Summary won’t help you with your Econ. What you need is the development of your analytical ability, which is necessary for doing data-based essays, by keeping doing exercises. Reviewing knowledge points over and over again only earns you a few points on the questions with the commands “define” and “identify”. Be a rational Economics learner!

In conclusion,
IG Economics is not worth summarizing.
Think about your motivation and the meanings of things. Problems will come to you with their solutions, which will help you achieve a better life. Identify what things in your life are meaningless for you, and stop doing them.
The unexamined life is not worth living.

entry.title: AS EAQ Full Mark Essay Writing
entry.content:
Task:
Write an essay about a genius, 150 words.

Model Answer(28/30):

Elon Musk: An Undeniable Genius
It is difficult to say that Elon Musk, the CEO of Tesla, is just a common man. So much of his genius is obvious.
Elon Musk attended the University of Pretoria when he was only 17 years old. He then moved to Canada and went to Queen’s University and University of Pennsylvania, before he received bachelor’s degrees in economics and physics.
In 2004, Elon Musk joined Tesla Motors, and four years later became its CEO. Before that, he was also the founder of Space X and Paypal. His work life has been very successful, making him become the richest person on the world, with a wealth of $213.9 million in 2022.
On the other hand, his family life has not been so ideal. Elon Musk described his father “evil”, and his second wife described her relationship with Elon Musk as “fluid”. This world’s wealthiest person stated that he did not like his father at all who had too many children, when he himself has nine children.
In conclusion, Elon Musk is a lengendary person, who is undoubtly genius.

entry.content:
一些备用知识点

  1. 国际单位：m, kg, s, A, K, mol, cd
  2. 牛顿运动定律

Chapter 1 Making Measurements

1.1 length&volume

  1. 测量工具：
    1） ruler 尺子 （e.g. metre ruler)
    测量注意点：（以wire为例）【4步】
  • straight，laid closely alongside
  • end: cut neatly/ragged
  • line one end of the wire up against the “0”
  • look at the other end and read
    一定要注意测出来的是否可以保证正确2）游标卡尺 螺旋测微器
    游标：L=整的毫米数（主尺）+0.1*n毫米（游标）
  1. 测量方法
    1）measure sth. thin
    以测纸的厚度为例：【3步】
  • take a stack of 500 sheets
  • measure its thickness
  • devide by 5002）measure sth. curved
    以测弯曲的铁条为例：【3步】
  • lay a thread along the line
  • mark the thread at either end
  • lay it along a ruler3）measuring volumes
    i. cube/cuboid
    【3要素】
    • length
    • width
    • height
      =multiply
      other regular shapes(spheres…):
      look up the equation for the volume
    ii. liquids
    measuring cylinder 量筒
    beaker 烧杯
    look at the scale horizontally and read the level of the bottom of the meniscus(简单表达：eyes level with the scale)
    用最合适的量筒。e.g. 你不能用5ml的量筒测10mliii. measure bu displacement (for irregular objects) 【6步】
    • select a cylinder 3 or 4 times bigger than the object
    • fill in water
    • note V1

  1. 国际单位：
    SI units：metre（m)
    1l=1dm^3 1ml=1cm^3
    1deci(dm): 0.1m 1centi(cm):0.01m
    1mili(mm):0.001m 1micro(um):0.000001m
    1kilo~(km):1000m

1.2 Density

  1. 公式：
    Density (ρ)=Mass (m)/Volume (V)
    做题时m和V两个要素缺一不可
  2. SI units: kg/m^3
  3. 密度的性质：
    1）Gas<solid/liquid
    2）任何在水面漂浮的物体密度都比水小。（e.g.冰）
    3）许多物质都有不同的密度（e.g.木头）
    4）水的密度：1*10^3kg/m^3, 1g/cm^3
    5）immicible不溶中最上层的液体密度最小

1.3 Measuring Time

  1. 测量工具：
    analogue(指针）clock
    digital(数字）clock (most precise）
  2. 测量方法：
    测量短时间：e.g.plumb bob单摆
    方法同1.1的2.1）相似

本章注意点

  • 单位换算
  • 各种物质的密度大小
  • 特殊物体的m/v/ρ测量方法
  • 读数
  • 计算ρ=m/V

Chapter 2 Describing Motion

2.1 Understanding Speed

  1. 公式：
    Speed(average)(v)=Total Distance(s)/​Total Time(t)
  2. SI units: m/s
  3. Speed in the laboratory
    light gate
    法1:
    • start the timer: peg attached to the trolley breaks the beam of one of the light gate
    • stop the timer: breaks the second timer
      法2：
    • mount an interrupt card(遮光片) on the trolley
    • start the timer: the leading edge of the interrupt card breaks the beam
    • stop the timer: the trailing edge passed the gate

2.2 Distance-time Graphs


注意看清楚横轴和纵轴

2.3 Understanding Acceleration

  1. 定义：
    acceleration: 加速度
    the rate at which its speed is changing/the change in speed per unit time
  2. 性质：
    vector矢量 e.g.velocity
    scalar标量 e.g.speed. (具体见3.6）
  3. 图像：
    speed-time graph
    • the steeper the slope, the greater the acceleration
    • a negative slope means a deceleration
    • a horizontal graph(slope=0) meeans a constant speed
      distance travelled=area under speed-time graph

2.4 Calculating Speed And Acceleration

  1. 公式：
    Acceleration (m/s)2=y2​−y1​​/x2​−x1​= Δv​/Δt

本章注意点

  • 公式
  • 实验（light gates）
  • 图像的绘制，性质，相关计算
  • 矢量和标量的区别（具体见3.6）

Chapter 3 Forces And Motions

3.1 We Have Lift-Off

  1. 牛顿（Newton)
    1N=举起一个苹果的力
    定义：the force required to give a mass of 1 kg an acceleration of 1 m/s^2
  2. 各种种类的力：
    • 重力(gravity)—the weight
    • 支持力(constant force)—-when two objects touch
    • 摩擦力(friction)—opposes motion
    • 空气/液体阻力(air resistance/drag)
    • 浮力(upthrust)
  3. 力的性质&合力：
    1）力有方向，大小，作用点
    2）力可以改变物体的速度和方向
    3）合力(resultant force):
    合力定义：the single force that has the same effect on a body as two or more forces
    合力性质：当合力为0时，物体没有加速度，并且物体保持静止或匀速直线运动
    合力判定：当物体物体没有加速度，并且物体保持静止或匀速直线运动，合力为0
    合力计算：注意合力有方向！
    triangle rule&parallelogram rule(见3.6）
    注意位移

3.2 Mass, Weight and Gravity

  1. 重力(gravity)：
    定义：the force that exists between any two objects with mass
    方向：vertical downward
  2. the acceleration of free fall/acceleration due to gravity/gravitational field strength on Earth(g):
    g=9.8N/kg
    关于the acceleration of free fall和acceleration due to gravity和gravitational field strength的区别：
    the acceleration of free fall和acceleration due to gravity是一个东西，都是指地球上的g
    gravitational field strength指g，如果在后面加一个“on Earth”就是上面那两个东西的意思了
  3. g的计算：
    gravitational field strength(g)=weight(W)/mass(m)
  4. weight和mass的区别:

    点击图片尽享高清
    以上图片取自物理八年级下教材解析

3.3 Falling And Turning

  1. terminal velocity: 终端速度
  2. 一个例子：跳伞运动员(parachutist)
    当他往下坠落的时候，一开始他的重力比空气阻力大，后来他的重力和阻力一样大，当他把伞打开时重力比阻力小，最后他的重力和阻力再次一样大。（速度时间图是一个长得像海啸的东西，参照IG书第50页）
  3. 圆周运动：
    【易错点】圆周运动中的加速度方向是从圆上一点指向圆心的一个箭头，一瞬间的运动方向是从圆上一点沿切线出去的一个箭头。（口诀：半径加速度，切线一瞬间）
    如何增加圆周中的合力：
    1）增加物体质量 2）增加物体速度 3）减小圆周半径

3.4 Force, Mass and Acceleration

  1. 公式：
    force=mass*acceleration
    F=ma
  2. 注意点：
    质量必须是kg单位，不是g，如果力是以N为单位。

3.5 Momentum

  1. 定义：
    momentum 动量：动量(是指国际单位制中的单位为kg·m/s ，量纲MLT⁻¹）表示为物体的质量和速度的乘积，是与物体的质量和速度相关的物理量，指的是运动物体的作用效果。动量也是矢量，它的方向与速度的方向相同。
    （摘自百度百科，有下划线字点开会跳转到对应的百度百科页面）
  2. 公式：
    1！！
    momentum=the quantity mass* velocity
    p=m*v
    （同样的公式可以被用来求m和v）
    2！！ impulse 冲量：
    impulse=the change in momentum
    impulse=FΔt=Δ(mv)
    3！！ resultant force:
    resultant force=change in momentum/unit time
    F=Δp/Δt=Δ(mv)/Δt
  3. the principle of the conservation of momentum:
    动量守恒定律
    the total momentum is constant and does not change because of an interaction between bodies(such as collisions撞击)
    total momentum before=total momentum after

3.6 More About Schalars and Vectors

  1. Schalars: 标量
    has magnitude only
    schalar quantities: distance, time, speed, mass, energy, temperature
  2. Vectors: 矢量
    has magnitude and direction
    vectors quantities: velocity, force, weight, acceleration, momentum, electric field strength, gravitational field strength
  3. 关于triangle rule：
    书上写的实际是vector triangle法。
    首先把两条力等比画出来（一定要等比，画完还要在下面标注一下比例尺度），用箭头表示清楚力的方向。然后把第一个力的箭尾和第二个力的箭头连起来，这条线就是合力了，一个三角形也出现了。
    把三角形成功画出来后，可以用直接测量法，也可以用勾股定理(Pythagoras’ Theorem)。

本章注意点

  • 合力的计算
  • 矢量和标量
  • force, momentum等的公式

entry.title: Lies Told To Children
entry.content:
告诉孩子们的谎言
关于《Lies Told To Children》的中文翻译。
原作者：Eliezer Yudkowsky
原文网址：
https://www.lesswrong.com/posts/uyBeAN5jPEATMqKkX/lies-told-to-children-1

长大着，作为一个孩子，我总是被告知，每个智慧生命都是宝贵的，所有有思考和了解自己的东西——

是的，这是一个关于告诉孩子们谎言的故事。你可能很快就会提前自己弄明白的。至于现在，听着就行了。

我讲到哪里了？哦对。作为孩子，我们总是被告知，每个智慧生命都是宝贵的。这是老师告诉我们的，并在儿童电视上向我们展示——尽管我看过的动画片比我们这个年龄段的大多数孩子都少——儿童电视在我长大后受到了审查，虽然，当然，直到很久以后我才发现了这件事——

我看到你开始猜测我是在什么样的情况下长大的。猜吧，如果你愿意，就写下预测。也许你已经看到了整个事情的发展方向。但你问我的是一个关于我作为孩子被告知谎言的故事，而这就是你得到的。如果很多这样的故事是可以预测的，那不是我的错；对孩子撒谎的人除了不可预测性外，还有其他地方需要优化。

所以我讲到哪里了？哦对。我在一个有三千人左右的偏远村庄长大，那里山比房子还多。穿过森林的迷人旅行路径。不是每个人都认识每个人，但你肯定认识认识任何人的人。

我所在地区的儿童电视受到了审查，尽管他们在我们小时候没有告诉我们这一点。但我们看到的儿童电视有外星人、怪物和幻想生物，有四条腿或十四条腿，三张脸或根本没有脸，电视节目将他们都视为有意义的生命。有时在动画片中，有一些外星怪物，他们只认为自己的生活是有价值的，然后也许你不能以朋友的身份与他们交易。也许他们已经骗过你一次，你无法足够信任他们以与他们协商，也许你根本不能和他们说话。但他们的生活对故事的人类主角来说仍然有意义，即使是一些生命对自己毫无意义的外星人。如果有任何方法可以避免，你不会给他们带来痛苦；你并不会杀死他们，除非他们的生物学与人类足够相似，以至于你对你在事后冷冻保存它们的能力有信心。

这些节目从未详细说明，也从未说过，“而这是因为在任何情况下都有一个普遍规则，即智慧生命都有价值。”不过，我们的老师倒是明确表示了这一点。

他们也这样对待我们每个孩子，就好像我们的生命有意义一样。

除了红头发的孩子；那些肮脏的红头发。

我看到了，你一眼神明了的点头。这是你预测到的吗？不完全是，也许，但是差不多？我想之后我们打开你的预测时，我会知道的。

红头发的孩子几乎不需要红头发作为他们的靶标；他们看起来也与我们其他人不同。当我大到可以第一次问问问题的时候，有人告诉我，他们是那些因在某处犯下可怕罪行而被从遥远城市流放的人的孩子，他们因我们自己仁慈的恩典和怜悯而获得庇护。红头发的孩子比我们其他人都大，拥有更多的成人面部结构特征，以至于你可能会把他们误认为是伪装的非常小的成年人。红头发的成年人，我们很少见过，他们相应地更加巨大而肌肉发达。回想起来，你可以看到——如果你真的在试图思考，虽然我们并不是真的在——有人可能会觉得被如此肌肉发达的人威胁了，即使他们慷慨地给予他们庇护。

与我们一起接受教育的红发孩子并不多；少数人，四六个孩子。我不能通过想名字来数他们，因为他们保持沉默，从不试图和我们其他人做朋友。

他们回答的速度比我们班上其他人慢。在极少数情况下时，老师问他们问题，他们经常会回答错误。我们是孩子，年幼的孩子，所以我们当然没有问自己“这实际上是智力的内在缺陷，还是关于谁从老师那里得到更多努力的自我实现的预言？”或者想出任何实验来用这种或那种方式进行测试。我们只是无言以对地认为：红头发的孩子更愚蠢；而这也是一条通用规则，就像重力一样。

我们，事实上，并没有那么善待我们的红发同学。我们正处于一个时期，孩子们从成年人那里接受他们的线索，但并不仔细重新思考他们看到的一切。我们注意到大一点的孩子如何对待红头发的孩子，我们注意到老师如何对待红头发的孩子，我们注意到巨大的红头发成年人，他们默默地扫走廊，不做任何智力劳动。我们注意到成年红发的人是如何被其他成年人甚至非红头发的大孩子随意推到一边的，以及红头发的成年人是如何默默地接受的。

有各种名字可以称呼他们，“肮脏的红头发”，和更糟糕的绰号，粪便上的脏话在我们这咯咯地笑。

偶尔你会看到一名安全官员过来问一些红头发的人一些问题。有一次，安全官员带走了一名看门人，之后，就再也没有人见到他了。我想有个孩子在课堂上确实问过那个人发生了什么事，老师立马让她闭嘴了，说任何关于肮脏的红头发的问题，或者关于安全的问题，如果你问的话，最好私下问。

与此同时，我们不得不看的动画片仍然教训着，所有智慧生命都是宝贵的，十四条腿或没有脸也没有例外。

当然，最终，它开始达到一个点，然后它确实达到了一个点。

开始到了这样一个点，一个红头发的孩子在课堂上被叫起来，回答错了问题，老师问他的父母是否因为忙于偷别人的书，没法教他如何阅读。那个红头发的孩子什么也没说，但我明显畏惧退缩了。

到了这样一个点，在那两天后，当我下课走回家时，我听到回家小路外的呻吟声，听起来像是痛苦的呻吟声。

我离开了小路，绕着一座小山跑，然后发现后面藏着一个肮脏的红头发，他的左裤腿上满是血。

他求我不要去找大人。

他说他正在躲避安全官员。

他让我帮他走路，帮他逃走。

那感觉不真实。感觉就像我在一个儿童节目里一样。

当然，在儿童节目中，他们总是展示英雄们提醒着自己事情是真实的，他们必须做正确的事情，因为这是真实的，所以我知道我需要记住这是真实的，因为当你在电视节目中时，这就是你应该做的。

我想我应该很害怕，尽管我不记得自己害怕了。

我问他做了什么来让官员找他。

他说，几天前，他谈到了红发人士应该得到比现在更好的治疗，和一个他以为并曾希望是朋友的非红发人。

我把手伸给他，这样他就可以借着那只没有沾满鲜血的腿站起来，然后他靠在我身上，我们越过山丘，直到我们见到一个红发女人——这种你看到的更少——低声感谢我，然后把他带走了。

我跑着回到小路上，跑回家了，当然，我还是迟到了。我爸爸问我去了哪里，我说我看到了一只长的很滑稽的蝴蝶，然后跑去追它了。我记得，即使在那时，我也相信他知道我在撒谎，但爸爸没有再问我任何问题，我也没有告诉他任何事情。

大约一个小时后，安全官员敲了敲我们的门，问每个人是否见过一个红头发的人——当然，这张照片上肯定是我帮助离开的那个人。

我说不，我没见过他。但因为我还是个孩子，那个年龄的孩子没有被教过如何欺骗，我问这个人做了什么，让他被认为是危险的。直到为时已晚，我才想到这是否是我应该问的问题-

安全官员问我是否想改变主意，看看逃犯。

我给了他我最好的惊讶眼神，并拒绝了。

安全官员指出，安全官员们接受过阅读情感的特殊培训，而对他来说，我似乎很害怕。

我说是的，我是，因为安全官员暗示我在撒谎，这令我害怕。

安全官员说，在这一点上，他非常清楚我在撒谎。但如果我告诉他逃犯去了哪里，并认出和他在一起的其他人，我就不会有麻烦。

我说他不知道自己在说什么。

安全官员严厉地看了我一眼，说他发现了另一个谎言，我真的想因为一些肮脏的红头发而惹上麻烦吗？

我告诉他我不傻，我知道他在虚张声势，试图欺骗我，因为他怀疑我，即使我没有这样做。

他从口袋里拿出一张照片给我看。

是我在帮助那个红头发的男人用他的那条好腿走路。

为什么，安全官员说。他现在看起来很失望。我为什么要这样做？ 为什么肮脏的红头发值得？

我记得，到那个点时，我才注意到我很害怕，而且我想我那时正试图摆脱它——通过证明，我是在服从成年人的权威——我们都在课堂上被告知，每个智慧生命都是宝贵的，所有思考和了解自己的东西，这就是我们得到的规则，而在任何时候都没有人能合理地争论红头发的人是个例外，而且我们都被告知伤害别人是错误的，你不应该让社会一致性把你推向它。

其余的都按照你预测的方式进行。

安全官员笑了。

我的父母冲进来拥抱我，告诉我，我一直很勇敢，很好，并且足以获得20年前的上五百分位数得分在我这个开始反对并不再同意的年龄；并解释说，文明需要不时地测试一些孩子，以了解我们在环境和遗传方面对人们的善良和抵制一致性推动的残忍方面做得怎么样；并测试早期报道的错误，在该错误中，关于公平和良好待遇人的一般规则最终将以某种方式不适用于某些子群体；以及我们的小村庄正在测试二十年前的一个重要有条件预测市场，市场上押注着数百万小时的劳动时间；儿童成长为好人是整个文明的重要功劳，许多重大政策决定了它，这就是为什么这值得让我们专门化村庄做科学工作，而他们希望我理解这一切，不会马上告诉其他孩子。实际上没有安全官员之类的东西，如果有的话，那就意味着是时候立即推翻政府了。

我以睿智、理解和相当麻木的方式点头。我想我最后说的主要事情是，我最好为帮他们保守秘密得到报酬，他们都笑了，说我当然会，很多钱，至少和我父母得到的一样多，因为孩子也是有智慧生命的生物。

这就是我关于我们对孩子们说谎的故事。而我现在最看重的，甚至比我当时和年纪大时得到的钱还要重要的，甚至比知道我在文明里唯一一个真正的考验中表现良好和勇敢还要重要的，那就是，我在任何关于“对孩子说谎”的讲故事夜晚几乎总是赢。

entry.title: The Meaning of Living
entry.content:
The Meaning of Living

Slytherin

He argued around on the ground floor. In the common room stood the four Hogwart’s founders and sometimes some other characters from other buildings came nearby to take part in the discussion.
Salazar Slytherin was making a speech, based on my terrible life.
Yes, my terrible life.
In addition, my unclear future and messy time schedule had made my mind palace turned into pessimist mode.
“Please, there’s no meaning in living! Everyone knows that.” He chattered. The air was filled with pungent freshness, and the night had already crawled in.
“No, no, living…is having a meaning!” Someone who Slytherin thought was called Simon Cleary said, pouring a pint of beer into his mouth.
Salazar Slytherin didn’t want to argue with him.
“Life is meaningless. We are just small dust in the universe, and what we are doing, has nothing to do with the universe. The universe itself doesn’t have life, no autonomous consciousness. It just keeps breeding. If life is a practice, the end of practice is death anyway. Then why do you have to suffer so much? There are so many things to worry about every day. Isn’t direct death a direct liberation? Life has no meaning. We abandon everything to give it meanings, which is nothingness. Because it has no meaning at all, it is how it comes and goes, and the final outcome is death. Whether you do evil or do good in your life, it is nothing more than the different evaluation of the world. In a few years, no one will remember who you are. In the end, you are just a piece of the vast tombstone. Happiness is brief, sadness is enduring…”
“Emm are you sure we are going to talk about these discouraging remarks? I mean, it’s also meaningless to talk about this, I mean, even if you realise you’re the only person who realise life is meaningless, what can you do about it?” Logic pointed out.
“Actually, I’ve already made a plan about how we can suicide elegantly and mysteriously.” Godric Gryffindor waved his hand.

Gryffindor

Godric Gryffindor thought the plan was perfect, at least to him.
They would first make it to eighteen, the perfect age which I turned into an adult in law. Then at that time, they would discuss again about whether I should suicide. Because everyone knew that not until I turned into an adult who had capacity of stable thinking, all of them shouldn’t make any big decision because it’s definitely not mature.
Then, Gryffindor believed, if they still agreed on suiciding, his plan would help a lot.
He would first book a ticket to Bermuda. Seeing the Bermuda Triangle, just to know where they would be dying. Then he would be spending the money on travelling around the world, because there’re some really good friends in different countries they want to see. Mostly friends made online.
In the end, they would learn how to ride a boat. They would buy a boat, and row it into the Bermuda Triangle with “scientific reasons”. At that time, they would fall into a black hole, or just die in the sea.
If they fell into a black hole, then that’s great, they get to experience new stuff. And if they died, there’s no cost for themselves because they’re already a dead body. Not to mention whether they would exist after I died.
This was a perfect way to suicide. Dying in the ocean with all the sea creatures and people would be explaining the matter to my relatives and friends like:”It was an accident.”.
“You do realise that you’re getting Slytherin in the way of thinking right?” Rowena Ravenclaw muttered.
“But this is just a thought after all. We are not going to do it right away, we are just thinking it seriously. There’s a lot of preconditions to consider about before we take actions.” Salazar Slytherin tapped Logic on the shoulder.
“I can already hear people telling you this is nonsense when you say this to them.” Politician said, “Maybe they will laugh.”
“I still agree on myself. We should definitely experience killing ourselves before drowning into the sea.” Cheerilee said.
“Geeze, we can talk about this when she turned 18, but not now okay? Everything we are saying now is pointless because we are not mature characters yet! And she’s only an adolesent!” a male Hufflepuff moarned.
Everyone shut, excepted Gryffindor.
The discussion was over.

Wen

Wen was still thinking about the meaning of life.
In the reporting hall, sunshine glittered. Ming walked in, saying:”Still thinking about the meaning of life?”
Wen only nodded.
The broadcasting room started to ring. People quickly realised that it was my friend calling me, and rushed into the room to hear the conversation.
It was from my best friend July, so nobody left the room.
Then Wen suddenly realised the meaning of life.
Then she realised she realised the meaning of living.
It was that there was no meaning in myself living. Because I could not take the responsibility of my life. I could not be responsible for myself. When I died, nobody care, nobody know.
I could always sink into the Ideological imprisonment I built for myself. If I wanted, even if I was a failure I could still feel good about myself. If I wanted, I could give up everything, fames and money, and even life. Because nobody was taking control of my life, I could do whatever I want.
But, Wen thought about July.
She thought about Ming, and all those characters just like her.
She thought, maybe the meaning of living wasn’t in myself. Maybe it’s in, that I need to take responsibility in others who loved me.
If I couldn’t get into a good university and get a good job, I may couldn’t get a glamorous future to my beloved ones. I could be failing every day, but she couldn’t imagine the impacts it would have on others.
“That’s a good emotional point.” Ravenclaw said.
“Are we being both self-confident and normal?” Logic asked.
“You know when others depressed you, you would become critical once you think in this way right?” Quirinus Quirrell confirmed.
“Why you take responsibility of others? Others have nothing to do with you.” The Dark Side.
“Turns out we have fallen into the ideological imprisonment we built for ourselves in the end.” Ravenclaw sighed.
“I thought we’ve finally figured it out.” Wen said innocently.
“This is driving me crazy.” Ming stated.

Politician

There’s no meaning in life, according to Salazar Slytherin. And there’s a perfect plan to suicide, according to Godric Gryffindor. And there’s also a good reason for living which is based on self-moving, according to Wen.
Politician decided there’s no reason in living but we still need to live on.
“Why?“ Slytherin roared.
“No why. It’s just that we don’t have proper reasons for thinking this philosophical ‘meaning of living’, because as Logic said, we can do nothing about it at the moment.”
“Besides, we don’t have the ability to think up an answer to it yet.” Logic pointed out.
“So, after all this time, we don’t have a conclusion?” Ravenclaw.
“No.” Hufflepuff.
“Shouldn’t we be saying some soul soother thing just to end our meeting?” Michael recommended.
“That would be lying.” Slytherin grinned.
“My conclusion is, we should put this aside, and move on to our life. Just like others do.” Politician said.
There was Alice’s Doctor Bungy arguing “avoiding is just leaving matters to tomorrow” but Slytherin got some people to get his mouth shut.
And then I started working again.

The End.
